meanings.definition: Bright, distinct, and clear in color or shape.
meanings.sent1: The flowers in the garden were the vividest I had ever seen.
meanings.sent2: The artist used the vividest shades of blue and green in the painting.
meanings.sent3: The vividest umbrella at the store was a bright neon pink!
meanings.sent4: Her vividest memories were of the colorful sunsets at the beach.
meanings.sent5: The vividest rainbow arched across the sky after the storm.

meanings.definition: Producing powerful feelings or strong, clear images in the mind.
meanings.sent1: The horror movie had the vividest scenes that haunted my dreams.
meanings.sent2: The novel painted the vividest picture of the protagonist's emotions.
meanings.sent3: His vividest fear was of spiders, even the tiny ones.
meanings.sent4: The vividest emotions flooded her heart as she watched the sunset.
meanings.sent5: The vividest dreams often come after a day full of adventures.

meanings.definition: The superlative form of vivid, meaning the most vivid.
meanings.sent1: In the art competition, her painting was voted the vividest of all.
meanings.sent2: The vividest in the collection was a breathtaking landscape.
meanings.sent3: The vividest in the class won a special award for their artwork.
meanings.sent4: The vividest of memories often come from our happiest moments.
meanings.sent5: The vividest of dreams can inspire us to reach for the stars.
